greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: a(1,1) = 1. a(m,m) = sum of all terms in rows 1 through m-1. a(m,n) = a(m-1,n) + (sum of all terms in rows 1 through m-1), for n < m.
comment: A159928(m) = -A075374(m+4)+A075374(m+3), for m >= 1. -A075374(m+4) = the sum of all terms of triangle A159927 in rows 1 through m. A159928 contains the row-sums of triangle A159927.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..11476 (Rows 1 <= n <= 150).
example: The sum of all of these terms is 110. Adding 110 to each term of the 4th row, we get: 25+110=135, 24+110=134, 23+110=133, 19+110=129, 0+110=110. So row 5 is 135,134,133,129,110.
maple: A159927 := proc(n,m) option remember; local rs; if n = 1 then 1; else rs := add(add( procname(i,j),j=1..i),i=1..n-1) ; if n = m then rs; else procname(n-1,m)+rs; fi; fi; end: for n from 1 to 10 do for m from 1 to n do printf("%d,",A159927(n,m)) ; od: od: # _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 28 2009
mathematica: NestList[{#1 + #2, #2} & @@ {Join[#1, {0}], Total[#1] + #2} & @@ # &, {{1}, 0}, 8][[All, 1]] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Aug 30 2017 *)
